summary: Common chicory is a plant with blue (or sometimes white/pink) flowers, originally from Europe but now found worldwide. It has many uses: its leaves are eaten in salads, its buds can be blanched and cooked, and its roots are used as a coffee substitute and food additive. Inulin, a sweetener and dietary fiber, is extracted from chicory roots. Additionally, chicory is grown as food for animals.
title: Chicory
